pli-tv-bi-vb-ss6:2.1: The nuns’ rules and their analysis
pli-tv-bi-vb-ss6:3.1: The chapter on offenses entailing suspension
pli-tv-bi-vb-ss6:4.1: 6. The second training rule on receiving food
pli-tv-bi-vb-ss6:5.1: At one time the Buddha was staying at Sāvatthī in the Jeta Grove, Anāthapiṇḍika’s Monastery.
pli-tv-bi-vb-ss6:5.2: At that time the nun Sundarīnandā was beautiful.
pli-tv-bi-vb-ss6:5.3: When people saw her in the dining hall, they were affected by lust, and they gave her the best food.
pli-tv-bi-vb-ss6:5.4: Being afraid of wrongdoing, Sundarīnandā did not receive it.
pli-tv-bi-vb-ss6:5.5: The nun next to her said,
pli-tv-bi-vb-ss6:5.10: “What can this man do to you, whether he has lust or not, when you’re without it?
pli-tv-bi-vb-ss6:5.11: Go on, Venerable, receive it yourself, and eat whatever staple or non-staple food he gives to you.”
pli-tv-bi-vb-ss6:6.1: The nuns of few desires complained and criticized her,
pli-tv-bi-vb-ss6:6.4: ‘What can this man do to you, whether he has lust or not, when you’re without it?
pli-tv-bi-vb-ss6:6.5: Go on, Venerable, receive it yourself, and eat whatever staple or non-staple food he gives to you’?” …
pli-tv-bi-vb-ss6:6.6: “Is it true, monks, that a nun said this?”
pli-tv-bi-vb-ss6:6.12: ‘What can this man do to you, whether he has lust or not, when you’re without it?
pli-tv-bi-vb-ss6:6.13: Go on, Venerable, receive it yourself, and eat whatever staple or non-staple food he gives to you’?
pli-tv-bi-vb-ss6:6.14: This will not give rise to confidence in those without it …
pli-tv-bi-vb-ss6:6.15: And, monks, the nuns should recite this training rule thus:
pli-tv-bi-vb-ss6:7.1: ‘If a nun says, “Venerable, what can this man do to you, whether he has lust or not, when you are without lust? Go on, Venerable, receive it yourself and then eat whatever staple or non-staple food he gives to you;” then that nun too has committed an immediate offense entailing sending away and suspension.’”
pli-tv-bi-vb-ss6:8.4: … The nun who has been given the full ordination by both complete Orders through a legal procedure consisting of one motion and three announcements that is irreversible and fit to stand—this sort of nun is meant in this case.
pli-tv-bi-vb-ss6:9.2: if she urges her on, saying, “Venerable, what can this man do to you, whether he has lust or not, when you are without lust? Go on, Venerable, receive it yourself and then eat whatever staple or non-staple food he gives to you,” then she commits an offense of wrong conduct.
pli-tv-bi-vb-ss6:9.4: If, because of her statement, the other nun receives staple or non-staple food with the intention of eating it, she commits an offense of wrong conduct.
pli-tv-bi-vb-ss6:9.5: For every mouthful, she commits a serious offense.
pli-tv-bi-vb-ss6:9.6: At the end of the meal, she commits an offense entailing suspension.
pli-tv-bi-vb-ss6:10.2: this is said with reference to the preceding offenses.
pli-tv-bi-vb-ss6:11.2: there is an offense as soon as the misconduct is committed, and no pressing is required.
pli-tv-bi-vb-ss6:12.2: she is sent away from the Order.
pli-tv-bi-vb-ss6:13.2: … Therefore, too, it is called an offense entailing suspension.
pli-tv-bi-vb-ss6:14.1: If she urges her on to receive water or toothwood, she commits an offense of wrong conduct.
pli-tv-bi-vb-ss6:14.2: If, because of her statement, the other nun receives it with the intention of eating it, she commits an offense of wrong conduct.
pli-tv-bi-vb-ss6:15.1: If only one of them has lust, and she urges her on to eat staple or non-staple food received from the hand of a male spirit, a male ghost, a eunuch, or a male animal in human form, she commits an offense of wrong conduct.
pli-tv-bi-vb-ss6:15.2: If, because of her statement, the other nun receives it with the intention of eating it, she commits an offense of wrong conduct.
pli-tv-bi-vb-ss6:15.3: For every mouthful, she commits an offense of wrong conduct.
pli-tv-bi-vb-ss6:15.4: At the end of the meal, she commits a serious offense.
pli-tv-bi-vb-ss6:15.5: If she urges her on to receive water or toothwood, she commits an offense of wrong conduct.
pli-tv-bi-vb-ss6:15.6: If, because of her statement, the other nun receives it with the intention of eating it, she commits an offense of wrong conduct.
pli-tv-bi-vb-ss6:16.2: if she is the first offender.
pli-tv-bi-vb-ss6:17.1: The sixth offense entailing suspension is finished.
